snippet: After fighting for Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, hundreds of Tuareg rebels helped themselves to some of his weapons and returned to Mali to continue a longstanding rebellion.
abstract: Hundreds of Tuareg rebels, after fighting for Colonel Muammar el-Qaddafi in Libya before his death, have helped themselves to a considerable quantity of weapons from his vast arsenal and returned to Mali to continue a longstanding rebellion; officials say that they are facing the most serious threat ever from the insurgents, who have begun storming towns in the country's northern desert and forcing standoffs with the Malian army.
lead_paragraph: After fighting for Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, hundreds of Tuareg rebels helped themselves to some of his weapons and returned to Mali to continue a longstanding rebellion.

headline.seo: Tuaregs Use Qaddafi’s Arms for Rebellion in Mali
headline.main: Qaddafi’s Weapons, Taken by Old Allies, Reinvigorate an Insurgent Army in Mali
headline.print_headline: Qaddafi’s Weapons, Taken by Old Allies, Reinvigorate an Insurgent Army in Mali

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
